conclusion: Analyze the graph to determine the coefficient of kinetic friction and mass of A.
The graph shows the relationship between acceleration a and force F.
The slope of the graph a/F represents the combined mass of objects A and B.
From the graph, when F = 60 N, a = 8 m/s².
Calculate the slope m as 2/15 kg/N.
The total mass M of A and B is 7.5 kg.
The net force causing acceleration is F - f_k, where f_k is the kinetic friction force.
Using Newton's second law, calculate f_k = 3 N.
The friction force f_k is given by f_k = μ_k * m_A * g.
At maximum static friction, f_k = m_A * a.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between A and B is 0.6.
The mass of A is 0.5 kg.
